1.text: Straightforward, completely familiar, highly practiced, routine.

2.text: Straightforward, requiring simple response to a dedicated alarm, covered in procedures.

3.text: Manual, visual or communication with opportunity for confusion between data.

4.text: Simple but quickly performed with reduced attention or accuracy.

5.text: Not automated nor routine; procedures must be followed to restore or shift system state.

6.text: Requiring rules to identify situation and interpret alarm or indication patterns.

7.text: Complex, requiring a high level of understanding and skill.

resultSettings.busyTimePerFleet: PM Freight Dispatcher spent, on average, more time on Freight Railroads than any other type of railroads. They were least busy with Other Sources.
resultSettings.busyTimePerTask: PM Freight Dispatcher spent, on average, more time on Other Communications than any other type of tasks. They were least busy with Temporary Bulletin (Issue).
resultSettings.waitTimePerFleet: PM Freight Dispatcher waited, on average, more time on Freight Railroads than any other type of railroads. They were least busy with Other Sources.
resultSettings.waitTimePerTask: PM Freight Dispatcher waited, on average, more time on Other Communications than any other type of tasks. They were least busy with Turn Over Task (begin).
resultSettings.busyTimePerOp: PM Freight Dispatcher No.1 was between 36-65% busy

textStrings.questionHours: 1. How many hours are your train dispatchers working this shift?
textStrings.questionTransition: 2. If your dispatchers have transfer-of-duty periods, when do they occur?
textStrings.tooltipTransition: Transitioning period is the period where the incoming and outgoing operators discuss relevant issues from the prior shift.
questionTransitionDuration: At the beginning of their shifts, how long does this transfer-of-duty last?
At the ending of their shifts, how long does this transfer-of-duty last?
textStrings.questionExtremeCondition: 3. Will there be any extreme conditions during this shift?
textStrings.tooltipExtremeCondition: Abnormal issues that would increase dispatcher workload.
textStrings.tooltipCondition1: All tasks affected by weather will arrive 10% more frequently.
textStrings.tooltipTask: Tasks given to the operator(s) during their shift(s).
textStrings.qWeather: 2. Is this task affected by weather?
textStrings.tooltipTaskWeather: Yes means the task will arrive 10% more frequently.
textStrings.qTraffic: 3. Is this task affected by traffic?
textStrings.tooltipTaskTraffic: Yes means the arrival rate of this task will be affected by traffic levels.
textStrings.qTeamCoordination: 4. Is this task affected by team coordination?
textStrings.tooltipTaskCoord: Yes means the task is affected by level of team communication
textStrings.tooltipInterruptible: Yes means the dispatcher can put this task on hold to complete other tasks and return to this one later.
textStrings.tooltipTaskFreq: This determines arrival time, or the time at which the task enters the system.
textStrings.tooltipTaskWait: This determines expiration time, the time at which a task will expire or the time by which it must exit the system.
textStrings.tooltipTaskComplete: This determines service time, the total time required for an operator to process the task.
textStrings.tooltipTaskFollowTime: This determines the dependent inter-arrival time
textStrings.tooltipTaskFollow: 'Add Following Task' creates a new task with an arrival rate that is dependent on this original task’s arrival.
textStrings.qFleets: How many different railroads do the dispatchers manage?
textStrings.qNumVeh: How many subdivisions are on this railroad?
textStrings.tooltipFleetComm: Subdivision-to-subdivision Radio Communications: A railroad with some level of local communications demands less from a dispatcher. Some: reduces rate of task arrivals by 30%. Full: reduces rate of task arrivals by 70%.
textStrings.tooltipFleetTask: These tasks arrive from the railroads.
textStrings.tooltipFleetTraffic: Traffic levels affect the arrival rate of certain tasks. Low: tasks arrive half as often. Medium: tasks arrive as normal. High: Tasks arrive twice as often.
textStrings.tooltipFleetOther: Tasks from other sources do not arrive from the railroads. E.g. Miscellaneous (Dispatcher break time)
textStrings.tooltipFleetOtherTraffic: Traffic levels affect the arrival rate of certain tasks. Low: tasks arrive half as often. Medium: tasks arrive as normal. High: Tasks arrive twice as often.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorFlex: Flex team assists all types of dispatchers whenever their workload is above 70%.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorFlexNum: How many of these chief dispatchers are on duty this shift?
textStrings.tooltipOperatorTeam: Does the dispatcher share the same desk with other dispatchers?
textStrings.tooltipOperatorSize: How many dispatchers are on the team?
textStrings.tooltipOperatorComm: Partial: Communicate with team once every 10 minutes, lasting an average of 10 seconds; 30% more likely to catch a human error. Full: Communicate with team once every 5 minutes, lasting an average of 10 seconds ; 70% more likely to catch a human error.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorTask: What task types for which railroads/sources are these dispatchers expected to execute?
textStrings.tooltipOperatorStrat: Which strategy does the dispatcher employ to handle tasks? First In First Out: In chronological order of arrival. Shortest Task First: In order from lowest service time. Priority: Based on order of importance.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorPriority: Essential tasks: highest priority, rise to the top of the queue, can interrupt any interruptible task that a dispatcher is busy with, cannot be interrupted.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorAI: Three types of artificial intelligence (AI) agents: Equal Operator, Assisting Individual, Assisting Team Coordination (must have some level of team communication).
textStrings.tooltipOperatorAIequal: AI that can handle any task that the dispatcher handles. Employed when the human dispatchers are unavailable, and a task arrives.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorAIindiv: AI that directly supports dispatchers by reducing human error probability as well as how long it takes them to complete selected tasks.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorAIindivLevel: Level determines human performance speed. Partial: Human performance is 1.4 times faster. Service time decreases by 30% on each task that the AI assists. High: Human performance is 3.3 times faster. Service time decreases by 70% on each task that the AI assists.
textStrings.tooltipOperatorAIteam: AI that is available when there is some level of team coordination (more than one dispatcher in a team during the same shift).
textStrings.tooltipOperatorAIteamLevel: Level determines team communication speed. Partial: Team communication is 1.4 times faster, reduces team communication time by 30%. High: Team communication is 3.3 times faster, reduces team communication time by 70%.
textStrings.tooltipCondition0: Essential task that lasts 20 to 40 minutes, arrives once every 8 hours of a shift on average.
